it.unimi.di.law.bubing.util

Class ByteArrayDiskQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unimi.di.law.bubing.util.ByteArrayDiskQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Size64, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ByteArrayDiskQueue
extends Object
implements Closeable, Size64
    A queue of byte arrays partially stored on disk.

    This class is a wrapper around a ByteDiskQueue that provides methods to enqueue and dequeue() byte arrays. Like a ByteDiskQueue, and instance of this class has a suspend() method that releases the file handle without deleting the dump file. The file handle is reinitialized lazily (which implies that a certain number of enqueue(byte[])/dequeue() calls can be performed on a suspended class without actually reopening the dump file).

    Similarly to a ByteDiskQueue, you can freeze() and then reopen a ByteArrayDiskQueue.

    See Also:
    ByteDiskQueue

    • Method Detail

      • createNew

        public static ByteArrayDiskQueue createNew(File file,
                           int bufferSize,
                           boolean direct)
                                    throws IOException
        Creates a new disk-based queue of byte arrays.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that will be used to dump the queue on disk.
        bufferSize - the number of items in the circular buffer (will be possibly decreased so to be a power of two).
        direct - whether the ByteBuffer used by this queue should be allocated directly.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        ByteDiskQueue.createNew(File, int, boolean)

      • createFromFile

        public static ByteArrayDiskQueue createFromFile(long size,
                                File file,
                                int bufferSize,
                                boolean direct)
                                         throws IOException
        Creates a new disk-based queue of byte arrays using an existing file.

        Note that you have to supply the correct number of byte arrays contained in the dump file of the underlying ByteDiskQueue. Failure to do so will cause unpredictable behaviour.

        Parameters:
        size - the number of byte arrays contained in file.
        file - the file that will be used to dump the queue on disk.
        bufferSize - the number of items in the circular buffer (will be possibly decreased so to be a power of two).
        direct - whether the ByteBuffer used by this queue should be allocated directly.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        ByteDiskQueue.createFromFile(File, int, boolean)

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(byte[] array,
           int offset,
           int length)
             throws IOException
        Enqueues a byte-array fragment to this queue.
        Parameters:
        array - a byte array.
        offset - the first valid byte in array.
        length - the number of valid elements in array.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • dequeue

        public void dequeue()
             throws IOException
        Dequeues a byte array from the queue in FIFO fashion. The actual byte array will be stored in the queue buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buffer

        public ByteArrayList buffer()
        Returns the current buffer of this byte-array disk queue. The last dequeue() has filled this buffer with the result of the dequeue operation. Only the first k bytes, where k is the number returned by dequeue(), are valid.
        Returns:
        the current buffer of this byte-array disk queue.
